Text.Page: Commander Tamur ordered you and Hasmina to infiltrate Argonea in an effort to harry the argons' rear echelon, as well as reestablish contact with the town of Kanstria. Kanstria was cut off when the argons surrounded the town and disabled the flight platform, but you made it through the lines. The magistrate asked you to find several missing scouts. Hasmina led you to them, and the argons' troop transport portals. You recovered the fallen scouts' dog tags and delivered the bad news to Kanstria.

[Meet up with {@Creature:248#2011$$Hasmina} for an operation behind the lines in Argonea.

Hasmina has experience and knows the terrain. She'll brief you on the mission details.

—Tamur

Listen, uh, I wanted to thank you for saving my life. I didn't think I'd make it out of the Three Towers.

There's not much time. The fighting here has slowed down, so we're going to try an assault on the argons' rear echelon. First, we need to make contact with Kanstria. We lost touch with them after the last argon surge.

I'll meet you on the outskirts of the town.

See those reddish pillars? That's Kanstria. There should be a response force just out of sight.

The proximity of those kalashes worries me. Do you think the argons killed everyone? Are we too late?
Federation soldiers? You're a sight for sore eyes!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What happened here?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

The argons did something to our flight platform. It doesn't work, and we're cut off. We sent a patrol to Khanovar Citadel, but we never heard back from them.

Look, you should really talk to the magistrate. Take this letter—I'll vouch for you. Good luck.
New faces...does that mean the federation's secured the province?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Not exactly. We're here to help."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Hmm. Celtan vouches for you. That's good enough for me.

Look, we haven't sat idle this whole time. I've sent anyone I could spare to link up with federation forces, but none came back. Finding them, or even what happened to them, would be a boon for our morale. Can you help us?

I heard him. I-I'm ready to go. There's a small overwatch north of here. I used to hide there when I was a little girl. If the scouts survived, I bet that's where they're hiding.

Head to the Melgatol Portal. I'm going to check one other spot first, but I'll meet you at the hill overlooking the portal.

See those portals? That's where the argons bring in their reinforcements. If only we had some of those siege weapons...

You—I mean we—should get a closer look. Let's go, before I lose my nerve.

Look down there! It's an active portal. This is where they're gathering forces to send to the {@Rgn:48001$$Khanovar Front}. So many...

Let's go. I want to leave. Now!"Wait, aren't those the Kanstrian scouts?"

Yes.

I'm sorry. I lost my head for a moment.

We'll take their dog tags back.

Dead? All of them?

I feared as much, of course, but I—I still hoped they'd return safely.

Did you find the scouts yet?

I'd like to give their comrades some good news, so please hurry.
I heard your report to the magistrate. I'm sorry to hear the scouts all died. They left under my orders. Blast and damnation!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"They died doing their duty."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

True enough. They didn't die cowards. That might give some comfort to their families, should we ever reestablish contact with the rest of the world.

Thank you for bringing back their tags. Only a fellow soldier knows how much that matters.
